title: Freeze & Crash a Chromebook with Simple URLs

steps.title: Open Google Chrome on your Chromebook.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on your Chromebook. Click the icon on your desktop or taskbar that looks like a blue circle surrounded by a multicolor circle.

steps.title: Type chrome://inducebrowsercrashforrealz/ in the URL bar.
steps.content: Type chrome://inducebrowsercrashforrealz/ in the URL bar. This is a built-in debugging link that simulates a browser crash. Keep in mind that this will crash the Chromebook, so you will lose any unsaved work.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter on your keyboard to crash your Chromebook.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter on your keyboard to crash your Chromebook. While this will crash your Chromebook, you can start it back up easily after the crash.

steps.title: Try these other built-in URLs to crash your Chromebook.
steps.content: Try these other built-in URLs to crash your Chromebook. These other debugging URLs also crash many Chromebooks as well as the Google Chrome web browser on other computers: chrome://crash/ chrome://gpucrash/ chrome://restart/

steps.title: Yes, the damage done depends on the nature of the crash.
steps.content: Yes, the damage done depends on the nature of the crash. Since crashes can be caused by a variety of problems, the damage will vary. [1] X Research source A mild crash could result in losing data that wasn’t saved. An operating system crash may occur if there’s corrupted information on the disk. This could cause additional crashes even after rebooting the computer. [2] X Research source A crash caused by hardware issues may indicate that one of your Chromebook’s physical components is already damaged.

steps.title: The amount of tabs that will crash a Chromebook depends on your model.
steps.content: The amount of tabs that will crash a Chromebook depends on your model. Chromebooks with more random-access memory (RAM) can open more tabs before crashing. If you're using an older Chromebook with less RAM, opening many tabs (especially tabs with processor-intensive activities like streaming video and games) will likely freeze or crash your Chromebook. If your Chromebook is crashing or freezing unexpectedly, try closing tabs.

steps.title: Your Chromebook might be crashing due to a software or hardware issue.
steps.content: Your Chromebook might be crashing due to a software or hardware issue. Crashes or freezes may occur if there is an error with the operating system. Physical hardware failures can also cause crashing. [3] X Research source An out-of-date operating system increases the chance of your Chromebook crashing. Excessive heat or dust can cause hardware to fail and crash the computer. Read about more ways to diagnose potential issues causing freezing .
